cleaned_text: Requests (PDF)](https://www.maine.gov/pfr/professionallicensing/sites/maine.gov.pfr.professionallicensing/files/inline-files/policy_license_verifications_0.pdf) Effective March 1, 2019, the Office of Professional and Occupational Regulation (OPOR) will no longer issue paper license verifications. License verifications are available, free of charge, on OPOR's official database, [https://www.pfr.maine.gov/ALMSOnline/ALMSQuery/Welcome.aspx?board=4380.](https://www.pfr.maine.gov/almsonline/almsquery/welcome.aspx?board=4380) This database is updated in real time as changes occur. The Office of Professional and Occupational Regulation considers this information to be a secure, primary source for license verification. Many of our services are now available online: [Apply for a License](https://licensing.web.maine.gov/cgi-bin/online/licensing/begin.pl?board_number=4380)This option includes licensure applications for: Pharmacy Technicians, Pharmacy Interns, Pharmacist, Certificate of Administration of Drugs and Vaccines, Collaborative Drug Therapy Management, Prescription Drug Manufacturers, Opioid Prescription Drug Manufacturers, Mail Order Pharmacy and a Pharmacy located in the State of Maine [Pharmacy PIC Change](https://licensing.web.maine.gov/cgi-bin/online/licensing/begin.pl?board_number=4380)(for currently licensed Maine pharmacies) [Renew a License](https://licensing.web.maine.gov/cgi-bin/online/licensing/begin.pl?board_number=4380) [Reinstate a License](https://licensing.web.maine.gov/cgi-bin/online/licensing/begin.pl?board_number=4380)This option is only available to a person whose license to practice pharmacy in this State has been suspended, revoked, or restricted [Obtain a License Verification](https://www.pfr.maine.gov/almsonline/almsquery/welcome.aspx?board=4380)Effective March 1, 2019 the Office no longer issues paper license verifications. License verifications are available, free of charge online.
